dta.Connector¶

class dta.Connector(id, startNode, endNode, reverseAttachedLinkId, facilityType, length, freeflowSpeed, effectiveLengthFactor, responseTimeFactor, numLanes, roundAbout, level, label)¶

Bases: dta.Link.Link

A Connector is a Link that connects a RoadNode with a Centroid or a VirtualNode.

__init__(id, startNode, endNode, reverseAttachedLinkId, facilityType, length, freeflowSpeed, effectiveLengthFactor, responseTimeFactor, numLanes, roundAbout, level, label)¶

Constructor. Verifies one node is a RoadNode and the other node is either a Centroid or a VirtualNode.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • startNode, endNode are Nodes
  • label is a string, or None

See RoadLink for the rest of the args. Why do these make sense for centroid connectors? Answer: many centroid connectors are based on road links; all of them at the boundaries Therefore they have the same set of attributes and those attributes are meaningful.

Putting RoadLink attributes heres for now, re-examine this (like should they go into the Link?)

Methods

__init__ x.__init__(...) initializes x; see x.__class__.__doc__ for signature
Connector.euclideanLength
addLanePermission(laneId, vehicleClassGroup)¶

Adds the lane permissions for the lane numbered by laneId (outside lane is lane 0, increases towards inside edge.)

addOutgoingMovement(movement)¶

Adds the given movement.

addShapePoint(sequenceNum, x, y)¶

Adds a shape point to the link for the given sequenceNum

euclideanLength()¶

Calculates the length based on simple Euclidean distance.

getEndNode()¶

Accessor for endNode

getReferenceAngle()¶

Visualizing the link as a straight vector from (0,0), returns the angle between <1,0> and this link.

So returns a number in [0,2pi), increasing clockwise.

These are based on the euclidean length of the link, so assumes a straight line. If the link has no length, returns 0.

getStartNode()¶

Accessor for startNode

iterOutgoingMovements()¶

Iterator for the outgoing movements of this link

updateNodesAdjacencyLists()¶

Instructs the relevant nodes about this link
